The Saccharomyces cerevisiae inhibitor of apoptosis ( IAP) repeat protein Bir1 localizes as a chromosomal passenger.
The middle region is not essential but is required to localize the inner kinetochore protein Ndc10 to the spindle during anaphase and to the midzone at telophase.

We conclude that phosphorylation of the middle region of Bir1 is required to bring Ndc10 to the spindle at anaphase, which is required for full spindle elongation.

Zac1 is a histone acetylation - regulated NF - kappaB suppressor that mediates histone deacetylase inhibitor - induced apoptosis.

Rat liver mitochondria can hydrolyse thiamine pyrophosphate to thiamine monophosphate which can cross the mitochondrial membrane in a carrier - mediated process.
